item.title: How can I edit this batch file
item.dc:creator: @s_p_i_d_a_z s p i d a z
item.description:
@s_p_i_d_a_z wrote:

have you tried it? It should work.

if so and it doesn’t work try this

@echo off title Invision pking cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\Bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause

Read full topic
item.source: How can I edit this batch file

item.title: How can I edit this batch file
item.dc:creator: @sckum555 sckum555
item.description:
@sckum555 wrote:

Its all weird.

@echo off
@TITLE E Bunny’s Compiler
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles(x86)%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

My JDK folder is here: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21

My old compiler used to be simple you just change one thing and it works now I can’t find it.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I edit this batch file
